about_the_game:
What is Idol Hell?
🎀Idol Hell is a 2D, Touhou-like, Shoot 'em up, bullet hell game taking inspiration from Japanese school idols and anime tropes.

🎶In Idol Hell, you play as Medli, a robot schoolgirl idol set on a warpath to free her closest friend.
Fight through hordes of enemies and other cutesy robot idols in this vibrant, precision-based game.

Beginner Friendly Bullet Hell?
Our goal with this game was to make a bullet hell that newcomers to the genre and veterans alike could enjoy! Bumble, our lowest difficulty, intends to ease players in so they can become comfortable with the controls and develop their own style of gameplay through a more forgiving experience.🌸
On Humble, the game picks up what we consider to be a proper challenge for players of all levels. We encourage new players to try and try again on Bumble so they may one day play through Humble, a massive accomplishment displaying developed reflexes and coordination at a high level!🎀
Rumble is where things pick up and where long-time fans of the genre should look. Indicated with red hues, this is where the game stops being generous requiring high-speed reactions and clinical navigation to finish.🎵
For a final challenge, Crumble is our “ridiculous” difficulty popular in the genre. We do not recommend players start here until they’ve seen every pattern at least once as Crumble offers little time to learn and works to defeat you at every turn. You have been advised.🎶

Idol Hell’s Game Design
For this game, we wanted to design in a way familiar to players of the genre while still developing a unique identity. The general pacing of the game is two waves of enemies introducing you to their attacks, a mid-boss that hints at the boss’ attack, a final wave including a medley of all enemies, and the boss herself.
Each boss alternates between a Warm Up attack followed by a Performance attack. Warm Ups are simple in style, typically copying the behavior seen already in the stage, and each consecutive warm-up will be similar to the ones before it in some way. Performances follow a Warm Up and are noted by a change in the background. Performances are very unique with experimental attacks the Idol has come up with herself. This means the nature of the Performances may seem unpredictable at first but can be mastered with understanding and practice. Learning the tempo of waves, Warm-ups and Performances is key to beating the game!

The Full Game Includes:
  • 4 Difficulty Levels!
  • 4 Different Game Modes to Play!
  • 6 Chapters!
  • 7 Cute Robot Idols!
  • 14 Songs Filled With Variety!
  • Hundreds Of Bullet Patterns!
detailed_description:
Kickstarter FULLY FUNDED!!

Thank you everyone who made this possible! Not only is Idol Hell fully funded, but we also hit our Switch Port goal! Idol Hell is coming to the Nintendo Switch! Thank you everyone!

Download the Demo!

Want to try the game out before playing it? Download our Demo for free! It contains less content than you will receive in the full title, but it still offers tons of content itself!

Demo Features:

  • 4 Difficulty Modes!

  • 3 Chapters!

  • Cool Bullet Patterns!

  • And Still Cute Robot Idols!
